DialogueRecords.Text: This world was created by three gods.
The God of Light, gifted elemental spirits to ensure we seeked wisdom passed down.
The Sacred Beast, gifted familiars to ensure no being felt alone in this world.
The Goddess of Darkness gifted emotions to ensure that choices were influenced by experience.
Today, four Great Elemental Regions are guided by the spirits.
And in the Tribal Lands, a small village still prays to the first gods...

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: It's getting late and we need to get ready for our voyage. First, let's find Nota.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Maybe the villagers will know where she is.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: I need to find Nota. Maybe the villagers will know where she is.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: I don't have any reason to visit Slyph right now.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: This road leads to the capital but my journey isn't taking me there.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Mom
DialogueRecords.Text: My child, I am going to be so sad when you leave.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Kim
DialogueRecords.Text: Look at you all grown up! Are you ready to explore the world?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Blake
DialogueRecords.Text: I can't wait until I'm old enough to train and become a spirit talker too!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Young Tom
DialogueRecords.Text: Arthur! I can't believe you're about to go on your journey. Nota was just here!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: **COUGH** Hey Arthur, how are you?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: I am okay! A bit nervous for my voyage today though and I can't find Nota.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: **COUGH** I see. Still planning to go on that trip with your familiar?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Yes. Wish I didn't have to leave home, but it's part of our journey.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: I understand. Since I was a child, I was somehow exposed to miasma.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: With my parents' death and my illness, I wasn't able to go on my voyage. **COUGH**

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: I think I saw Nota in the forest towards the east.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Thank you Shane! I will be right back!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: I think I saw Nota in the forest towards the east.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Thank you Shane! I will be right back!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: **COUGH** So you found Nota.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Yes! Thank you for all your help!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: Nota, you can't be running off anymore. You are Arthur's familiar.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: I know, I just needed some time to get some fresh air.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: I'm really going to miss you both... we have been friends for 18 years.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Shane... we will be back!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: I wonder why the gods made me this sick. I don't know why the spirits won't help more often.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Shane, don't speak like that... I know it's been hard but things will get better.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: I hope so. Some people from the capital are visiting in the next few days.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: Maybe I can see one of their doctors and find out why I'm still sick.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Okay... let's make a promise! Like when we were kids.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: **Cough** Ha ha, like a pinky promise?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: No! Like... a pack. We'll travel this world. The three of us.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: **Cough** Are you joking, Nota? I'm too sick.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: I'm in! I'm sure we can figure out a plan once our voyage is done.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: Fine, I will wait for you all here. Then we will see, ha! Just be safe okay?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: I'll make sure of it.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Okay, now I just gotta say goodbye to my family!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Yeah and you stay safe too. Let's go!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Shane
DialogueRecords.Text: Fine, I will wait for you all here. Then we will see, ha! Just be safe okay?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Why is Nota running off like that?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: I'm sorry Arthur...

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: [Nota looks sad... what should I do?]

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Are we truly ready for this voyage?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Of course we are! And if not, we'll take it day by day.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: You're right, let's go.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Hey, cheer up! We're gonna get through this together!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Thanks Arthur, I just don't want to let you down. Are we truly ready for this voyage?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Of course we are! And if not, we'll take it day by day.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: You're right, let's go.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Let's say goodbye to Shane and the family!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Yip!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Mom, Dad, and Modi! You're all here!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Mom
DialogueRecords.Text: Of course we are, we have to give you a proper send off!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Modi
DialogueRecords.Text: Can I go with them?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Mom
DialogueRecords.Text: Nooo Modi.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Modi
DialogueRecords.Text: But WHYYY!?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad
DialogueRecords.Text: Villagers become adults on their 18th birthday and must go on a voyage in the wilderness.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad
DialogueRecords.Text: They become stronger, learn from nature, and gain an understanding of the self.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad
DialogueRecords.Text: It has been a practice since the beginning.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Modi
DialogueRecords.Text: But when will Arthur and Nota come back?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Mom
DialogueRecords.Text: Whenever he feels ready to return.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Don't worry, I'm here to protect him and make sure he doesn't do anything stupid.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad
DialogueRecords.Text: Thank you Nota. Arthur, my son. I want to give you treasures for your journey.
Received Crystal Sword!
Received Old Map!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad
DialogueRecords.Text: Let this sword aid you in any challenges you face. Let this map guide you on your voyage.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad
DialogueRecords.Text: As you can see, there's not much on this map. This is where you will record your own path.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Understood. I will cherish these gifts dearly. I love you all so much and I think we are ready!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Dad, Mom, and Modi
DialogueRecords.Text: Good luck Arthur!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: Not quite! Have you talked with Shane tonight?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Arthur
DialogueRecords.Text: Yes, but I still got one more thing to tell him.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Nota
DialogueRecords.Text: We sure are. Let's go!
And so their journey began.
Arthur Lux Gladius wanted to become stronger.
He wanted to come back home as a warrior, a protector, and a ray of light.
One day he hoped to be the village leader and ensure their town lived in peace.
The young familiar Nota wanted to become confident.
As a familiar, she would remain by Arthur's side.
Five years passed since their voyage began. They trained everyday.
In moments of weakness, they relied on each other.
As the lake shimmered and the wind whispered, who had they become?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Slyph
DialogueRecords.Text: Slyph is now available to summon!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Undine
DialogueRecords.Text: Undine is now available to summon!
